title: How to Get More Free Pokeballs in Pokemon Go for Beginners

steps.title: Tap the Main Menu button.
steps.content: Tap the Main Menu button. This is the Poké Ball icon at the bottom of the Map View. The daily free box allows you to get random items for free once a day! [1] X Research source This is a great way to get more Poké Balls, especially if you’ve just started your Pokémon GO adventure or you’re recently getting into Pokémon.

steps.title: Tap Shop.
steps.content: Tap Shop . This will take you to the shop menu.

steps.title: Tap DAILY FREE BOX.
steps.content: Tap DAILY FREE BOX . It’s a yellow and blue box with a ribbon on top. [2] X Research source The contents of the box will be displayed when you tap on the box.

steps.title: Tap Exchange.
steps.content: Tap Exchange . This will put the contents of the daily free box in your bag. Hopefully it was a good amount of Poké Balls! Access your bag by clicking ITEMS in the main menu.

steps.title: Tap the Main Menu button.
steps.content: Tap the Main Menu button. This is the Poké Ball icon at the bottom of the Map View. You can buy additional Poké Balls using PokéCoins, the in-game currency of Pokémon GO. If you need more, you can use real money to get more PokéCoins.

steps.title: Tap Shop.
steps.content: Tap Shop . This will take you to the shop menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a Poké Ball pack.
steps.content: Tap a Poké Ball pack. There are a few different options at different price points: Pay 100 PokéCoins for 20 Poké Balls (5 PokéCoins per 1 Poké Ball) Pay 460 PokéCoins for 100 Poké Balls (4.6 PokéCoins per 1 Poké Ball) Pay 800 PokéCoins for 200 Poké Balls (4 PokéCoins per 1 Poké Ball)

steps.title: Tap Exchange.
steps.content: Tap Exchange . This will add the number of Poké Balls you bought to your bag. There might be a delay before they show up in your bag.

steps.title: Walk and approach a PokéStop or Gym.
steps.content: Walk and approach a PokéStop or Gym. PokéStops look like blue spinning cubes. Gyms appear as spherical arenas with a Pokémon and light beam on top of it. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the PokéStop or Gym.
steps.content: Tap the PokéStop or Gym. This will open the Photo Disc menu.

steps.title: Swipe the Photo Disc left or right.
steps.content: Swipe the Photo Disc left or right. This will make random items appear. Keep spinning until you find some Poké Balls. There’s a Daily Bonus of 500 XP and extra items for spinning your first Photo Disc each day. [5] X Research source If you complete a 7-day streak of daily spins, you’ll get 2500 XP and extra items! Note that you won’t get Great Balls until level 12 and Ultra Balls until 20. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Poké Balls to put them in your bag.
steps.content: Tap the Poké Balls to put them in your bag. Your new Poké Balls will be added to your current stack.

steps.title: Wait for the PokéStop to refresh.
steps.content: Wait for the PokéStop to refresh. Alternatively, look for another PokéStop in your area to collect more items right away. [7] X Research source After collecting items, a PokéStop will turn purple. You won’t be able to collect items again for around 5 minutes. You’ll know when it’s ready again when the Stop turns back to blue. [8] X Research source PokéStops will typically drop 3 to 4 items. Before reaching level 5, PokéStops will only give out Poké Balls and Eggs. After getting to level 5, PokéStops drops will increase and give up to 6 Poké Balls. But it will also reward you with Revives and Potions.

steps.title: Wait for the Gym to refresh.
steps.content: Wait for the Gym to refresh. Gyms are more likely to drop battle-oriented items like Potions and Revives. [9] X Research source You can get bonus items if you visit a Gym controlled by your team. Additional items will be available if you have a badge for the Gym as well.

steps.title: Tap the Research Tasks icon.
steps.content: Tap the Research Tasks icon. This is the pair of binoculars icon in the bottom right of the Map View. Research Tasks can reward you with various items (including Poké Balls) for completing in-game tasks. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to the FIELD tab.
steps.content: Navigate to the FIELD tab. The Research Menu will start in this tab by default. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Check your field tasks.
steps.content: Check your field tasks. Look for any tasks that have Poké Balls as a reward. For example, you may have a task to make 5 nice throws. This task will reward you with 5 Poké Balls when complete. Complete the task to claim the reward. Get more tasks by visiting PokéStops.

steps.title: Navigate to the SPECIAL tab.
steps.content: Navigate to the SPECIAL tab. This tab provides more quest-based, long-term tasks. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Check your special tasks.
steps.content: Check your special tasks. Find tasks that reward you with Poké Balls. For example, there’s a task for evolving 15 Pokémon that rewards you with 30 Poké Balls. Complete all the tasks to get the rewards! Special tasks may have subtasks that have their own rewards.

steps.title: Earn Poké Balls by meeting Adventure Sync milestones.
steps.content: Earn Poké Balls by meeting Adventure Sync milestones. Adventure Sync is a feature that syncs to your smartphone’s health and fitness apps to reward you for walking! There are different rewards for different distances covered by the end of a week (Monday at 9 AM for you local time). [13] X Research source Here are the reward tiers: 5 km rewards 20 Poké Balls 25 km rewards 10 Great Balls and 500 Stardust (with a chance of 3 Rare Candy or a 5 km Egg) 50 km rewards 1,000 Stardust (with a chance of 5 Rare Candy, 5 Silver Pinap Berries, a 5 km Egg, or a 10 km Egg) 100 km rewards 16,000 Stardust

steps.title: Tap the Nearby button on the Map View.
steps.content: Tap the Nearby button on the Map View. It looks like a rectangle with silhouettes of Pokémon inside. Join nearby Raid Battles for the chance to earn Poké Balls! [14] X Research source

steps.title: Tap RAID to go to the Raid tab.
steps.content: Tap RAID to go to the Raid tab. Here you can see Raids happening in your area.

steps.title: Tap a Raid to join.
steps.content: Tap a Raid to join. Raid Battles start when the countdown ends. Don’t worry if you miss a Raid, they happen frequently.

steps.title: Complete the Raid and get rewards.
steps.content: Complete the Raid and get rewards. If you and the other Trainers in the Raid Battle are successful, you’ll receive items (potentially including Poké Balls).

steps.title: Tap the Trainer Profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the Trainer Profile icon. This is the picture of your character in the bottom left corner of the Map View. Gifts from your friend may contain Poké Balls. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap FRIENDS at the top.
steps.content: Tap FRIENDS at the top. This will take you to the Friends tab.

steps.title: Check for Gifts.
steps.content: Check for Gifts. When a friend has sent you a Gift, a Gift icon will show up next to their Trainer picture. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a Trainer with a Gift.
steps.content: Tap a Trainer with a Gift. This will take you to a Gift-opening menu.

steps.title: Tap the Gift.
steps.content: Tap the Gift. This will open the Gift’s Postcard with information about where it was obtained.

steps.title: Tap Open.
steps.content: Tap Open . This will open the Gift and give you the items that were inside.

steps.title: Purchase a Pokémon GO Plus.
steps.content: Purchase a Pokémon GO Plus. This is an official accessory for Pokémon GO that uses Bluetooth to connect to your smartphone. Then, it can notify you of nearby Pokémon and PokéStops with an indicator light. [17] X Research source You can also use Poké Ball Plus, a Poké Ball-shaped device with the same functionality. This method applies to both devices.

steps.title: Open Pokémon GO.
steps.content: Open Pokémon GO. Start the app on your smartphone to begin the Bluetooth pairing process.

steps.title: Tap the main menu button.
steps.content: Tap the main menu button. This is the Poké Ball icon at the bottom of the map view.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It’s the gear icon in the top right of the main menu.

steps.title: Tap Pokémon GO Plus.
steps.content: Tap Pokémon GO Plus . Or, tap Poké Ball Plus if you’re using that device.

steps.title: Press the button on the device.
steps.content: Press the button on the device. When you press the button on the Pokémon GO Plus, the accessory will become discoverable on Bluetooth.

steps.title: Tap the Pokémon GO Plus.
steps.content: Tap the Pokémon GO Plus. This will appear on your smartphone’s Available Devices list. The Pokémon GO Plus will vibrate when it connects successfully. You’re all set up!

steps.title: Walk around with your Pokémon GO Plus.
steps.content: Walk around with your Pokémon GO Plus. To spin PokéStops, follow these instructions: Wait for a blue flash and vibration. This indicates you’re near a PokéStop. Press the button on the PokéStop. You’ll automatically spin the Stop. The device light will flash multiple colors. This means you got items!
